business.headline: Urban Company IPO closes today. Is it a risky bet as GMP soars on last day?Urban Company's initial public offering ends its bidding phase today after strong investor interest and rising grey market premiums.

Gold touches new lifetime high of Rs 1.13 lakh per 10 grams in DelhiGold prices surged to a new lifetime high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10 grams in Delhi on Thursday. The yellow metal has gained over 43% this year. Experts attribute the surge to central bank buying, exchange-traded funds inflows, and geopolitical tensions.

Zupee lays off 30% of staff as it adapts to India's Online Gaming ActZupee has rolled out a comprehensive relief package for employees affected by the layoffs. The support plan includes financial assistance beyond the standard notice period, with extra compensation based on years of service.
Will Diwali light up Dalal Street for investors?While the festival is often seen as a time for good fortune, experts say the stock market doesn't necessarily follow festive trends.
Rupee slides to all-time low as US tariffs biteThe Indian rupee hit a record low of 88.44 against the US dollar on Thursday, pressured by US tariffs and heavy foreign investor outflows.
Sensex, Nifty extend gains amid optimism over US-India trade dealThe NSE Nifty50 rose by 32.40 points to close at 25,005.5, while the BSE Sensex increased by 123.58 points, settling at 81,548.73.

UPS to NPS switch now allowed, but rules applyCentral government employees who opted for the UPS can now switch back to the NPS, the government has announced. However, this flexibility comes with specific rules and conditions that employees must follow.
Buying a phone on loan? Non-payment may lock your deviceCurrently, over one-third of consumer electronics, including mobile phones, are purchased on small-ticket loans in India.

Should you pay income tax with credit card? All you need to knowAs the tax filing deadline approaches, many taxpayers scramble to pay their dues. While net banking and UPI are common, using a credit card is also an option, but it comes with costs and benefits you should know.

Why even small income slips can trigger big tax notices, explains tax advisorThink a small slip in your tax return won't matter? Think again. Even missing Rs 5,000 bank interest has invited income tax notices. A tax advisor breaks down why AIS mismatches are a growing headache.

PF crisis: What makes withdrawing your own money so difficultFor decades, the Provident Fund has been seen as a loyal companion, quietly growing with every paycheque, waiting to support employees in tough times or after retirement. But when the time comes to withdraw it, many workers discover that accessing their savings is anything but simple.
Looking to invest in IT stocks? Here are the top picksDespite recent concerns around tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump in April, experts remain positive on the IT sector's future.

entertainment.headline: Actor Karishma Sharma jumps from moving local train, sustains injuriesActor Karishma Sharma sustained serious injuries after jumping from a moving local train in Mumbai. She updated fans about her condition via a post on social media.

Mirai review: Teja Sajja's fantasy epic delivers big thrills on small budgetRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025Mirai movie review: 'Mirai' narrates the story of a young warrior tasked with the protection of nine sacred scriptures that can turn any mortal into a deity. It delves into human values and emotions like compassion, ethics, hatred and greed.

Never done anything wrong: Raj Kundra on Rs 60-crore against him, Shilpa ShettyBusinessman-producer Raj Kundra commented on recent cheating allegations involving him and Shilpa Shetty. In an interview with India Today, Kundra maintained that neither he nor Shetty had done anything wrong.

Siddharth joins Freida Pinto for Netflix family drama Unaccustomed EarthActor Siddharth will lead Netflix's 'Unaccustomed Earth' alongside Freida Pinto. The family-drama series explores complex relationships within an Indian American community of Cambridge.

Ed Sheeran says watching Om Shanti Om is like introducing someone to Star WarsEd Sheeran expressed his admiration for actor Shah Rukh Khan's 'Om Shanti Om' and India's cultural diversity. His reflections highlight the rich talents and unique cinematic experiences across India.

Vampire Diaries' Nina Dobrev and Shaun White split 5 years after engagement: ReportAmerican snowboarder Shaun White and 'The Vampire Diaries' actor Nina Dobrev have ended their engagement, according to reports. The duo dated for five years before getting engaged in 2024

After Coolie cameo, Aamir Khan's next with Lokesh Kanagaraj shelved: ReportThe much-anticipated Aamir Khan–Lokesh Kanagaraj superhero project is reportedly shelved, leaving fans wondering about the director's next moves.

Tamannaah Bhatia, Diana Penty glam up Do You Wanna Partner screeningActors Tamannaah Bhatia and Diana Penty made a stylish appearance at the screening of 'Do You Wanna Partner.' The supporting cast, including Shweta Tiwari, Nakuul Mehta, Rannvijay Singha, Jasleen Royal and Sufi Motiwala, were also seen at the screening.

Punjabi artistes are India's passport to world, because beats break bordersPunjabi beats are rewriting pop culture's playlist globally. If you see that the world's dancing to it now, it's purely because of the global dominance of Punjabi artistes.

Awez Darbar warns Baseer Ali to lower his tone in Bigg Boss 19. Watch promoYou know the upcoming episode of a reality show is going to be an interesting one when a contestant ends his silence with a roar. A promo for the upcoming episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' promises exactly that and more.

Anushka-Virat were once kicked out of New Zealand cafe, says Jemimah RodriguesDuring their visit to New Zealand, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were reportedly asked to leave a cafe after a lengthy conversation with Indian women cricketers Jemimah Rodrigues and Smriti Mandhana. The incident was shared by Rodrigues in a latest interview.

The Rip teaser: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck stuck in money, morality and mayhemHollywood's BFF Ben Affleck and Matt Damon are reuniting in the crime thriller 'The Rip'. The crime thriller is set to release on Netflix in January 2025, exploring themes of trust and betrayal among Miami police officers.

Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle advance booking bursts through the roof in India'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' advance booking smashes records in India, set to redefine animated film success. The pre-sales in India crossed Rs 10 crore, breaking non-Hollywood records and signalling the anime's growing box office impact.

Mimi Chakraborty becomes first actor to wear bikini in a Bengali filmMimi Chakraborty has made headlines by becoming the first Bengali actor to shoot in a bikini for a Bengali film. She was seen in a swimwear for a song titled 'Choker Neele'.

Dilip's royal treatment from King of Mewar leaves Farah Khan speechless. WatchFilmmaker Farah Khan's latest vlog captured a unique experience with the King of Mewar. The video featured her cook Dilip receiving royal attention as she was humorously sidelined.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood song Tenu Ki Pata: Manoj Pahwa is star of Diljit's song 'Tenu Ki Pata' is the third song released from Aryan Khan's upcoming series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. Sung by Diljit Dosanjh, the track prominently features Manoj Pahwa and has further raised anticipation for the series' premiere.

The Dead Girls review: A wickedly funny bloodbath you won't see comingRelease Date:Wed Sep 10, 2025Netflix's 'The Dead Girls' is a darkly funny crime thriller from Mexico based on true events. Packed with murder, satire and stellar performances, it's a must-watch.

No misuse of name, image: High Court protects Aishwarya Rai's personality rightsThe Delhi High Court has granted Bollywood actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan protection over her personality rights, ruling that unauthorised commercial use of her name, image, or likeness violates her right to live with dignity.

Dulquer Salmaan's Kaantha postponed due to Lokah's success, new date to be outDulquer Salmaan and Rana Daggubati announced the postponement of 'Kaantha' to allow 'Lokah' to continue its successful run. New release date will be announced soon.

general news.headline: Indian-origin man beheaded with machete after argument at US motelA gruesome murder at a Dallas motel has shocked the city. Yordanis Cobos-Martinez used a machete to fatally attack 50-year-old Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah after an argument. The victim was killed in front of his wife and son.

Video: Charlie Kirk killer seen running across roof before jumping and fleeingConservative influencer Charlie Kirk's killer remains at large after his shooting on a Utah college campus. The FBI officials on Friday released a video footage showing the suspect running and jumping from a rooftop.

Trump to push G7 for higher tariffs on India, China over Russian oil: ReportG7 finance ministers will debate new US proposals for tougher economic measures on Russia, as Washington urges allies to escalate pressure and accelerate Europe's shift from Russian energy.

Netanyahu vows there will be no Palestinian state: This place is oursBenjamin Netanyahu ruled out a Palestinian state while signing an agreement to advance the contentious E1 settlement project, which would divide the occupied West Bank and expand housing in Maale Adumim.

Will Charlie Kirk's killing plunge US universities into deeper chaos?US college and university campuses, once known for high-quality education and a culture of inclusivity, have in recent years been in the news for growing cancel culture and incidents of violence. Conservative activist Charlie Kirk's killing at Utah Valley University could plunge American university campuses into a deeper crisis.

Live: Meeting at Nepal's Rashtrapati Bhavan shortly to decide on interim leaderNepal Gen Z Protest Live: As Nepal slowly returns to normalcy, after days of violent protests led by Gen Z, the discussions about who will take charge of the nation have taken the centre stage. With the Nepal Army having imposed nationwide restrictions, names such as former Chief Justice Sushila Karki, Kathmandu Mayor Balendra Shah, and former electricity board CEO Kulman Ghising are reportedly being considered to lead an interim government. 
India Today's Pankaj Das, Amit Bharadwaj and Rohit Singh are reporting from ground zero. Stay Tuned to IndiaToday.in for latest updates

Trump's envoy pick cites India's middle class, says want New Delhi to buy our oilSergio Gor, a close Trump aide and director of the White House Presidential Personnel Office, said that despite recent disagreements over tariffs and India's purchases of Russian oil, the US-India relationship continues to be "warm and strategically important."

FBI releases new photos of person of interest in Charlie Kirk's assassinationThe FBI released new photos of a person of interest in Charlie Kirk's assassination at Utah Valley University and urged the public to send tips through its portal.

Is this the Asian Spring?In the 2010s, mass protests in African and West Asian countries resulted in the Arab Spring. Nepal is among the South Asian countries, like Bangladesh, Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand and Pakistan, that has witnessed large-scale, youth-led agitations. The issues are similar. Is this an Asian Spring?

CP Radhakrishnan to be sworn in as Veep today, Rahul Gandhi unlikely to attendCP Radhakrishanan, 68, won the vice-presidential election on Tuesday, defeating the joint opposition nominee B Sudershan Reddy by a margin of 152 votes.

Who is Kulman Ghising, Nepal's India-educated 'power saviour' in race for top job?Gen Zers have proposed the name of Kulman Ghising, the man widely credited with ending Nepal's power outages, as a candidate for the interim Prime Minister.

Congress leader's 'Nepal-like situation in India' remark triggers BJP backlashCongress leader Udit Raj has drawn fire from the BJP after suggesting that India could face a Nepal-like situation if not for the strength of its Constitution.

India vs Pakistan tickets yet to sell out, premium seats at Rs 4 lakhAsia Cup 2025: Tickets for the highly anticipated India vs Pakistan clash remain unsold, contrary to expectations. In an unprecedentedly slow uptake, seats are still available in nearly half the stands of the 25,000-capacity Dubai International Cricket Stadium for Sunday's game.

Did Qatar backstab Hamas? 3 theories behind the brazen Israeli attackIsrael targeting Hamas's political leadership in Qatar was brazen as well as unprecedented. There are three major theories on why the strike could have possibly been a coordinated plot. We explain the different perspectives.

9/11 anniversary: Trump attends New York Yankees game, draws boos and cheersUnited States President Donald Trump has drawn mixed reactions from spectators while attending the New York Yankees game, after honouring the memories of the victims at the Pentagon. During the National Anthem, Trump was shown on the stadium jumbotron and received boos from some in the crowd, cheers from others.

Came on visitor visa, were handed guns: Punjab men duped into joining Russian armySeveral young men from Punjab have been duped and forced into joining the Russian army. Their families urged the government to step in and ensure that they are evacuated from the warzone.

Mirai review: Teja Sajja's fantasy epic delivers big thrills on small budgetRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025Mirai movie review: 'Mirai' narrates the story of a young warrior tasked with the protection of nine sacred scriptures that can turn any mortal into a deity. It delves into human values and emotions like compassion, ethics, hatred and greed.

Gukesh faces hattrick of losses at Grand Swiss, sparks concernsIndia's D Gukesh's struggles at the FIDE Grand Swiss continued on Thursday. The Indian Grandmaster lost his third match in a row, sparking major concerns in the chess community.

Brazil's top court sentences Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison for coup plotA five-judge panel of Brazil's Supreme Court convicted Jair Bolsonaro and handed him a 27-year sentence, making the 70-year-old the first ex-president found guilty of attacking democracy.

Video: Coimbatore man drags ailing father after 'hospital denies wheelchair'Tamil Nadu BJP accused state government of neglecting healthcare after a viral video showed a man dragging his ailing father at Coimbatore Government General Hospital as wheelchair was not provided despite a two-hour wait.

Backyard cricket goes viral: Wood brothers blend nostalgia and competitionMark and Jacob Wood transformed backyard cricket into a viral YouTube sensation during the COVID lockdown. Their backyard cricket content has helped them build a community.

Shivajinagar metro station to be named after St Mary? Row over Siddaramaiah's planSiddaramaiah's announcement that he would recommend naming an upcoming metro station in Bengaluru's Shivajinagar after St Mary has sparked a massive row.

US will sort out trade deal with India after it stops buying Russian oil: LutnickHoward Lutnick had previously taken a far tougher line on India, stating that New Delhi would soon be "saying sorry" and return to the negotiating table to resolve trade issues with the US.

2 men hunt python and cook its meat in Kerala, arrestedTwo men, Pramod and Bineesh, were arrested in Panapuzha for killing a python and cooking its meat. A case under the Wildlife Protection Act has been filed, and they were remanded in judicial custody.

sports.headline: After tri-series win, Pakistan aim for clinical start against depleted OmanPakistan head into Asia Cup 2025 with momentum after winning the UAE tri-series. Oman, on the other hand, are making their debut in the tournament under Jatinder Singh's captaincy.

With Babar-Rizwan gone, can Pakistan finally reset at Asia Cup 2025?The Pakistan cricket team head into the Asia Cup 2025 without the services of Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Could this be the cleanslate that Pakistan need in T20Is?

Gukesh faces hattrick of losses at Grand Swiss, sparks concernsIndia's D Gukesh's struggles at the FIDE Grand Swiss continued on Thursday. The Indian Grandmaster lost his third match in a row, sparking major concerns in the chess community.

Backyard cricket goes viral: Wood brothers blend nostalgia and competitionMark and Jacob Wood transformed backyard cricket into a viral YouTube sensation during the COVID lockdown. Their backyard cricket content has helped them build a community.

Shubman Gill on idols: Tendulkar shaped him first, Kohli's hunger drove him onShubman Gill reveals his two cricketing idols are Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. The India Test captain says Tendulkar inspired him early, while Kohli's passion and hunger shaped his approach as a maturing player.

CAFA bronze a start, but coach Khalid Jamil must build consistency: Bhaichung BhutiaIndia's CAFA Nations Cup bronze under Khalid Jamil brought promise, but Bhaichung Bhutia has warned that inconsistency could derail bigger ambitions. With AFC Asian Cup 2027 qualifiers ahead, India must show maturity and stability against stronger opposition.

India vs Pakistan tickets yet to sell out, premium seats at Rs 4 lakhAsia Cup 2025: Tickets for the highly anticipated India vs Pakistan clash remain unsold, contrary to expectations. In an unprecedentedly slow uptake, seats are still available in nearly half the stands of the 25,000-capacity Dubai International Cricket Stadium for Sunday's game.

Litton helps Bangladesh kickstart campaign with easy win over Hong KongAsia Cup: Litton Das played a captain's knock to help Bangladesh gun down the 144-run target against Hong Kong without any hiccups and secure a seven-wicket win in their campaign opener.

No cricket between India and Pakistan until bilateral relations improve: HarbhajanFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh said India and Pakistan should improve their relations before playing cricket against each other. India will take on Pakistan in their second group clash of the ongoing Asia Cup T20.

Madrid and Warsaw to host men's and women's Champions League finals in 2027UEFA has designated Madrid's Estadio Metropolitano for the 2027 men's Champions League final, while the women's competition will conclude at Warsaw's National Stadium. Both selections signify UEFA's strategy to broaden event sites and further both men's and women's tournaments across Europe.

Watch: Rohit Sharma flaunts BCCI logo on helmet, looks crisp in training videoRohit Sharma looked sharp and focused in a recent training video, proudly flaunting the BCCI logo on his helmet. The India ODI captain is gearing up for his return against Australia after nearly eight months.

India vs Pakistan tickets yet to sell out, premium seats at Rs 4 lakhAsia Cup 2025: Tickets for the highly anticipated India vs Pakistan clash remain unsold, contrary to expectations. In an unprecedentedly slow uptake, seats are still available in nearly half the stands of the 25,000-capacity Dubai International Cricket Stadium for Sunday's game.

No cricket between India and Pakistan until bilateral relations improve: HarbhajanFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh said India and Pakistan should improve their relations before playing cricket against each other. India will take on Pakistan in their second group clash of the ongoing Asia Cup T20.

Madrid and Warsaw to host men's and women's Champions League finals in 2027UEFA has designated Madrid's Estadio Metropolitano for the 2027 men's Champions League final, while the women's competition will conclude at Warsaw's National Stadium. Both selections signify UEFA's strategy to broaden event sites and further both men's and women's tournaments across Europe.

Watch: Rohit Sharma flaunts BCCI logo on helmet, looks crisp in training videoRohit Sharma looked sharp and focused in a recent training video, proudly flaunting the BCCI logo on his helmet. The India ODI captain is gearing up for his return against Australia after nearly eight months.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
